description.narrative: Output 4 [Child protection in emergencies] : At least 50% of children affected by humanitarian emergencies benefit from protection and reintegration measures, which contributes to Child Health, Child Protection And Emergencies, Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Health And Emergencies, Maternal And Newborn Health, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [Child Protection]: By 2019, children, especially girls, are better protected against violence, abuse and exploitation.
